intro: Gamocarpha alpina, commonly known as the alpine gamocarpha, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale blue to white, and it produces bracts that aid in seed dispersal. Gamocarpha alpina is adapted to high-altitude environments, demonstrating resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
